key_points: Jerry Rice discusses the Joe Montana vs. Tom Brady debate on 95.7 The Game's The Morning Roast.
Rice prefers Montana over Brady, citing the difference in eras and how the game is played.
He highlights that the NFL today is less physically demanding on players, especially quarterbacks.
Montana and Rice connected for 386 receptions, 6,710 yards, and 67 touchdowns in 77 games.
Tom Brady has won six Super Bowl championships over the past 20 years and is currently with the Buccaneers.
Brady has a 32-11 postseason record and Montana has a 16-7 record, showcasing both quarterbacks' playoff success.
Montana never lost a Super Bowl and has three Super Bowl MVPs, while Brady has lost three but won four MVPs.
Rice stays loyal to the 49ers and Montana, with whom he played most of his career.
Discussed are the changes in NFL rules to protect quarterbacks, like the rule change following Brady's 2008 season injury.
The debate centers not just on championships, but also on individual preferences for the era of play and quarterback style.
